intro: Adenilema fallax, commonly known as the slender adenilema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Adenilema fallax is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various climates.
